Class ConfigurationProperty

java.lang.Object
uk.co.spudsoft.params4j.ConfigurationProperty
public class ConfigurationProperty extends Object
Documentation for a single property found by reflecting the Parameters class.
Author:
jtalbut

  • Field Details

    • type

      public final Class<?> type
      The Java class representing the property.

    • name

      public final String name
      The name of the property. If the name contains [<n>] it represents a list of items and may be repeated as many times as desired with <n> being replaced by a monotonically increasing integer starting at zero. If the name contains <xxx> it represents a map of items and may be repeated as many times as desired with <xxx> being replaced by a string.

    • canBeEnvVar

      public final boolean canBeEnvVar
      If true this property can be represented as an environment variable. Lists cannot be represented as environment variables because the '[' and ']' characters are not permitted in environment variables in a Linux shell. It may still be possible to specify list properties as an environment variable as long as no Unix-like shell is required to process it. Terminal classes that cannot be represented as a single string cannot be represented as a single environment variable.

    • undocumented

      public final boolean undocumented
      If true this property cannot be specified as is, but requires additional child values to be specified. The child values are not documented here, the Comment annotation should be used for undocumented classes to provide instructions on where to find their details.

    • comment

      public final String comment
      The calculated documentation for this property. The calculated documentation for a field is found (in order) from: 1. The Comment annotation. 2. Javadoc comments on the setter. 3. Javadoc comments on the field with the same name as the property. When handling nested properties the documentation of the full hierarchy of fields is concatentated together.

    • defaultValue

      public final String defaultValue
      The default value for this property. This will only be found if the full path to the field is instantiated by default constructors.

    • appendUsage

      public void appendUsage(StringBuilder builder, int maxNameLen, String lineTerminator)
      Append an output suitable for use in response to a '--help' command.
      Parameters:
      builder - The StringBuilder that will have the details appeneded.
      maxNameLen - The length of the longest name in the set of ConfigurationProperties being processed. This must be calculated by the called before calling appendUsages for correct alignment. Given a List<ConfigurationProperty> this can be calculated with: 
      int maxNameLen = docs.stream().map(p -> p.name.length()).max(Integer::compare).get();
      lineTerminator - The string to put at the end of each line, probably "\n", but could be "\n\n" or "\r\n" if you prefer.

    • appendEnv

      public void appendEnv(StringBuilder builder, int maxNameLen, String prefixStrip, String prefixAdd, String lineTerminator)
      Append environment variable that can be used for this value.Will only change the builder if canBeEnvVar is true.
      Parameters:
      builder - The StringBuilder that will have the details appeneded.
      maxNameLen - The length of the longest name in the set of ConfigurationProperties being processed. This must be calculated by the called before calling appendUsages for correct alignment. Given a List<ConfigurationProperty> this can be calculated with: 
      int maxNameLen = docs.stream().map(p -> p.name.length()).max(Integer::compare).get();
      prefixStrip - String to be removed from the beginning of each name (typically '--')
      prefixAdd - String to be add to the beginning of each name (the namePrefix passed in to withEnvironmentVariablesGatherer)
      lineTerminator - The string to put at the end of each line, probably "\n", but could be "\n\n" or "\r\n" if you prefer.
